cli

Class ELCPaperOptionsCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • cli.ELCPaperOptionsCreator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptionsCreator

    public class ELCPaperOptionsCreator
extends java.lang.Object
implements OptionsCreator
    A factory class for creating Options objects with options for simulations conducted in accordance with the computer model described in the "Evolutionary language competition - an agent-based model" paper.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public org.apache.commons.cli.Options create()
        Returns an Options object with options for simulations conducted in accordance with the computer model described in the "Evolutionary language competition - an agent-based model" paper.

        Returned Options object contains the following options:

        • -n (--side) defines the side of the agents' lattice graph
        • -N (--agents) defines the number of agents
        • -N1 (--agents1) defines the initial size of the 1-lingual population
        • -N2 (--agents2) defines the initial size of the 2-lingual population
        • -d (--objects) defines the number of objects
        • -d1 (--devdegree1) defines the initial environment (number of recognized objects with the words belonging to a language) of the 1-lingual population
        • -d2 (--devdegree2) defines the initial environemnt of the 2-lingual population
        • -eps (--epsilon) defines the epsilon parameter
        • -var (--variant) defines the model variant
        • -v (--variantInfluence) defines the variant influence
        • -iv (--variantLanguage) defines the variant language
        • -p (--path) defines the json results file path
        • -s (--simulations) defines the number of independent simulations to be conducted
        • -stop (--stopIteration) defines the maximal number of iterations to simulate in every independent simulation
        All of the options are by default not required.
        Specified by:
        create in interface OptionsCreator
        Returns:
        An Options object with options for simulations conducted in accordance with the computer model described in the "Evolutionary language competition - an agent-based model" paper.
